content:
Week 1: Mapping Business Outcomes to Product Outcomes

Content: Systems Thinking : understanding actors, flows, bottlenecks
Systems Thinking Tools: behaviour over time graphs, causal diagrams, iceberg model
First principles thinking: actor, action, entity diagrams
Understanding different types of Business Models
Building KPI Trees for structured problem solving
Hands-on Learning:
Case on Swiggy Customer Support:
Building a KPI Tree to map business outcomes to product outcomes

Hands-on Learning: Case on Swiggy Customer Support:

metadata.title: Mapping Business Outcomes to Product Outcomes

content:
Week 2: Product Discovery & User Research

Content: Impact Mapping to map product outcomes to opportunities
User segmentation methodologies
Opportunity sizing
User Research Methodologies
Identifying unmet needs and Jobs to be Done framework
Journey Mapping & their relevance
Building User Personas
Affinity Mapping to derive insights from user research
How to use AI tools for user research
Hands-on Learning:
Case on an early stage food-tech startup:
Analysing a dataset to identify the target user segment and crafting a user research plan

Hands-on Learning: Case on an early stage food-tech startup:

Week 3: Problem Framing & Ideation

Content: Hypotheses building
Problem Framing canvas
Mindmapping solutions
Understanding Benefits and constraints for each actor
Understanding product risks
Crafting User Stories
Understanding Human Motivations to build solutions
Prioritising between solutions
Understanding how to build user flows and wireframes
Hands-on Learning:
Case on building a new feature for Spotify:
Build an AI assisted prototype using vibe coding tools

Hands-on Learning: Case on building a new feature for Spotify:

Week 4: UX Design & AI Prototyping

Content: Learn about UX Laws
How to think about Information architecture in UX Design
How to design prototypes on Figma
Learn AI assisted prototyping with vibe coding tools
Spec driven development with vibe coding tools
Data model driven development with vibe coding tools
Hands-on Learning:
SQL:
Learn how to write a data query with SQL

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 5: Product Growth & Metrics

Content: Different stages of the growth cycle
Minimum viable product (MVP) and Minimum Viable Test (MVT)
4 Fits of Product Market Fit
Loops, Funnels and Networks
Product Led Growth Strategies
Understanding Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Engagement, Revenue, Referral
Go to market (GTM) strategies in the AI age
How to define metrics
Customer Metrics and Business Metrics
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and North Star Metrics
Building a Metrics Tree
Guardrail Metrics or Key Failure Indicators (KFIs)
Data Analysis techniques: funnel and cohort analysis
Data tracking and instrumentation: events, variables and more
Hands-on Learning:
SQL:
Writing complex queries using JOINS

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 6: Tech 101 & System Design

Content: How the Internet works
Client-Server models
Different types of databases
APIs and their types: REST, SOAP, GraphQL
Synchronous and asynchronous APIs
High Level System Diagrams
AI system architectures
Cost vs quality trade-offs in AI products
Understand Version control
Set up GitHub
Set up Cursor
Hands-on Learning:
SQL:
Writing complex queries using aggregate functions & window functions
AI Tools:
GitHub and Cursor setup

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 7: LLMs & Prompt Engineering

Content: Basics of Machine Learning
Supervised vs unsupervised learning
Understanding Large Language Models (LLMs) and how they work
Difference between top LLMs
Anatomy of a Prompt
Prompt Engineering techniques
Context engineering and prompt decay
System prompts, temperature settings and more
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Build a basic chatbot by integrating with LLM APIs and system prompts

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 8: RAGs, Fine Tuning & AI Automations

Content: Embeddings & vector databases
Chunking & retrieval techniques
Workflow triggers & JSON
Orchestrating LLM steps
Chaining architecture
Adding reasoning and memory
Building AI workflows
How to fine tune models to add context
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Build a RAG enabled chatbot for a mutual fund house

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 9: AI Agents & Protocols

Content: What are AI workflows
Difference between AI workflows and AI agents
Agent frameworks
Long term and short term memory
Agentic AI protocols: MCP vs A2A
Multi-agent systems
Agent performance
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Building an AI workflow automation to analyse competitor ads data

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 10: AI Output Evaluation

Content: Failure modes & bias
Eval rubrics & metrics
Golden sets & A/B tests
LLM-as-judge limits
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Building an AI agent for a mutual fund house.

Hands-on Learning: Hands-on Learning:

Week 11: Interview Prep: Guesstimates & RCAs

Content: Types of Interviews
How to classify interview questions
Learn how to ask Clarifying questions during interviews
Understand how to approach Guesstimates questions
Master strategies to answer Root Cause Analysis (RCAs) questions
Interview Rubric for Guesstimates & RCAs
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors

Week 12: Interview Prep: Product Design & Metrics

Content: Learn how to answer Product Design questions
Understand how to answer Metrics Interview questions
Master strategies to answer A/B Testing questions
Interview Rubric for Product Design Questions
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors

Week 13: Interview Prep: Strategy & AI Product Sense

Content: Learn how to answer Product strategy questions
Master how to answer Pricing & GTM questions
Understand what are AI Product sense questions and how to answer them
Interview Rubric for AI Product Sense questions

Mock Interviews with mentors
Week 14-16:
Graduation Project
Continue to build portfolio
Work on graduation project
Submit graduation project
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors
Master the Tools to become a successful Product Manager
The NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship is designed to help you master tools that product managers frequently work with, through hands-on practice. Here are the tools that you will learn to use:
Microsoft Clarity & Hotjar:
For User Research
Whimsical:
For Mindmaps & KPI Trees
Figma:
For Wireframing & Design
JIRA:
For product roadmapping and execution
Google Analytics:
For product analytics
Microsoft Excel & SQL:
For data analysis
Open AI & Claude :
For prompt engineering
N8n & Make:
For AI workflows
Lovable:
For building

Hands-on Learning: to successfully transition into technology careers, thanks to a curriculum rooted in hands-on learning, personalised mentorship from industry leaders, extensive interview practice and a strong focus on job placement.

metadata.title: Interview Prep: Strategy & AI Product Sense

content:
Instructor: Arindam Mukherjee
Title: co-founder of NextLeap and was previously the head of consumer product and growth at Flipkart
Background: the head of consumer product and growth at Flipkart for almost 7 years
Teaches: curriculum in the first 3 weeks

Instructor: Karthi Subbaraman
Title: design team at ServiceNow
Background: worked at Microsoft and Salesforce as part of the design leadership team
Teaches: user research module

Instructor: Prashanth Bhaskaran
Title: product lead at Uber
Background: leading the data platform product at CRED
Teaches: Interview Prep module

Instructor: Eshan Tiwari
Title: Lead Data Scientist at Meta
Background: worked at Google in data science roles
Teaches: modules on AI

Instructor: Kartik Singh
Title: senior product designer at Microsoft
Teaches: Wireframing & UX Foundations modules

Instructor: Devansh
Title: Product Lead at Jiostar
Background: a Product Manager at Flipkart
Teaches: Metrics module and the case hour sessions

Instructor: Saksham Arora
Title: senior software engineer at Intuit
Background: a software engineer at Microsoft
Teaches: technology foundations module and how to build products with AI tools like Cursor

Instructor: Shailesh Sharma
Title: Senior Product Manager at Myntra
Teaches: Interview Prep modules
